trailingComments.value:
*
 * API client options object. Please use {@link APIClient#options} to get and set them.
 *
 * @typedef {Object} Options
 * @property {Object} [wsServer] WebSocket server configuration.
 * @property {String} [wsServer.protocol=ws:] WS protocol prefix.
 * @property {String} [wsServer.hostname=localhost] WS host name.
 * @property {Number} [wsServer.port=80] WS host port.
 * @property {String} [wsServer.prefixPath] WS prefix path.
 * @property {String} [wsServer.path=/websocket] WS path.
 * @property {Object} [xhrServer] XHR server configuration.
 * @property {String} [xhrServer.protocol=http:] XHR protocol prefix.
 * @property {String} [xhrServer.hostname=localhost] XHR host name.
 * @property {Number} [xhrServer.port=80] XHR host port.
 * @property {String} [xhrServer.prefixPath] XHR prefix path.
 * @property {('xhr'|'ws')} [primaryProtocol=xhr] Primary communication protocol.
 * @property {Boolean} [webSocketUpgrade=true] Whether the protocol can be upgraded to WebSocket.
 * @property {Function} [createWebSocket] Creates a WebSocket connection.
 * @property {Function} [packMessage] Pack the WebSocket message using JSON.
 * @property {Function} [unpackMessage] Unpack the WebSocket message using JSON.
 * @property {Function} [attachRequestId] Attach a request ID to every outgoing WebSocket message.
 * @property {Function} [extractRequestId] Extract the request ID from the WebSocket response.
 * @property {Number} [openTimeout=0] Timeout for the opening of a WebSocket connection.
 * @property {Number} [closeTimeout=0] Timeout for the closing of a WebSocket connection.
 * @property {Number} [responseTimeout=30000] Timeout for the responses of WebSocket requests.
 * @property {Boolean} [reconnect=true] Defines if WebSocket connection should be automatically re-established on close.
 * @property {Number} [reconnectionDelayIncrement=1000] Increment in delay with every reconnection attempt.
 * @property {Number} [maxReconnectionDelay=10000] Maximum delay when trying to re-establish WebSocket connection.
 * @property {Number} [maxReconnectionAttempts=10] Maximum number of attempts before giving up trying to re-establish a
 *   WebSocket connection.
 * @property {String} [accessToken] Access token to include in all requests where authentication is required.

leadingComments.value:
*
 * API client options object. Please use {@link APIClient#options} to get and set them.
 *
 * @typedef {Object} Options
 * @property {Object} [wsServer] WebSocket server configuration.
 * @property {String} [wsServer.protocol=ws:] WS protocol prefix.
 * @property {String} [wsServer.hostname=localhost] WS host name.
 * @property {Number} [wsServer.port=80] WS host port.
 * @property {String} [wsServer.prefixPath] WS prefix path.
 * @property {String} [wsServer.path=/websocket] WS path.
 * @property {Object} [xhrServer] XHR server configuration.
 * @property {String} [xhrServer.protocol=http:] XHR protocol prefix.
 * @property {String} [xhrServer.hostname=localhost] XHR host name.
 * @property {Number} [xhrServer.port=80] XHR host port.
 * @property {String} [xhrServer.prefixPath] XHR prefix path.
 * @property {('xhr'|'ws')} [primaryProtocol=xhr] Primary communication protocol.
 * @property {Boolean} [webSocketUpgrade=true] Whether the protocol can be upgraded to WebSocket.
 * @property {Function} [createWebSocket] Creates a WebSocket connection.
 * @property {Function} [packMessage] Pack the WebSocket message using JSON.
 * @property {Function} [unpackMessage] Unpack the WebSocket message using JSON.
 * @property {Function} [attachRequestId] Attach a request ID to every outgoing WebSocket message.
 * @property {Function} [extractRequestId] Extract the request ID from the WebSocket response.
 * @property {Number} [openTimeout=0] Timeout for the opening of a WebSocket connection.
 * @property {Number} [closeTimeout=0] Timeout for the closing of a WebSocket connection.
 * @property {Number} [responseTimeout=30000] Timeout for the responses of WebSocket requests.
 * @property {Boolean} [reconnect=true] Defines if WebSocket connection should be automatically re-established on close.
 * @property {Number} [reconnectionDelayIncrement=1000] Increment in delay with every reconnection attempt.
 * @property {Number} [maxReconnectionDelay=10000] Maximum delay when trying to re-establish WebSocket connection.
 * @property {Number} [maxReconnectionAttempts=10] Maximum number of attempts before giving up trying to re-establish a
 *   WebSocket connection.
 * @property {String} [accessToken] Access token to include in all requests where authentication is required.

*
     * Unlike original WebSocket it does not immediately open a connection. Please call {@link APIClient#open} method to
     *   connect.

trailingComments.value:
*
     * Performs request and waits for response.
     *
     * @param {Object} data Request data object.
     * @param {String} data.Path Request path, relative to server root. API prefix will be prepended automatically.
     * @param {('get'|'post'|'head'|'delete'|'options'|'put'|'trace'|'connect')} data.Method Request method.
     * @param {Object} [data.Headers] Request headers, key should be header field name, and value header field value.
     *   Authentication and debug headers will be added automatically, depending on current state.
     * @param {Object} [data.Body] Request body. If suitable for JSON transport (i.e. simple object), it will be
     *   automatically converted. Otherwise it will be sent as-is/raw, and request will fall back to XHR implicitly.
     * @param {Object} [data.Query] Request query parameters as a key/value pairs. Will be automatically encoded and
     *   appended to the request path.
     * @param {Object} [options] Request options object.
     * @param {String|Number} [options.requestId=<auto-generated>] Request ID which will be echoed by the server.
     * @param {Number} [options.responseTimeout] Timeout for the response, will use global value by default.
     * @param {Boolean} [options.xhr=false] Determines if the request should be sent as XHR. It will be implicitly
     *   turned on if body is not suitable for JSON transport.
     * @param {String} [options.apiPrefix=api/] Path prefix for the API endpoints (XHR only).
     * @param {('json'|'text'|'document'|'arraybuffer'|'blob')} [options.responseType=text] Expected XHR response type.
     * @param {Function} [options.onUploadProgress] Callback for upload progress (XHR only).
     * @returns {Promise}

value.raw: ' in param 'data' of the sendRequest() is required!
value.cooked: ' in param 'data' of the sendRequest() is required!

trailingComments.value: Check if body is in expected format suitable for JSON transport or should it be sent as-is (raw format).
Note that non-JSON body is supported only by an XHR request, so in this case turn this flag on implicitly.

*
     * Performs request and waits for response.
     *
     * @param {Object} data Request data object.
     * @param {String} data.Path Request path, relative to server root. API prefix will be prepended automatically.
     * @param {('get'|'post'|'head'|'delete'|'options'|'put'|'trace'|'connect')} data.Method Request method.
     * @param {Object} [data.Headers] Request headers, key should be header field name, and value header field value.
     *   Authentication and debug headers will be added automatically, depending on current state.
     * @param {Object} [data.Body] Request body. If suitable for JSON transport (i.e. simple object), it will be
     *   automatically converted. Otherwise it will be sent as-is/raw, and request will fall back to XHR implicitly.
     * @param {Object} [data.Query] Request query parameters as a key/value pairs. Will be automatically encoded and
     *   appended to the request path.
     * @param {Object} [options] Request options object.
     * @param {String|Number} [options.requestId=<auto-generated>] Request ID which will be echoed by the server.
     * @param {Number} [options.responseTimeout] Timeout for the response, will use global value by default.
     * @param {Boolean} [options.xhr=false] Determines if the request should be sent as XHR. It will be implicitly
     *   turned on if body is not suitable for JSON transport.
     * @param {String} [options.apiPrefix=api/] Path prefix for the API endpoints (XHR only).
     * @param {('json'|'text'|'document'|'arraybuffer'|'blob')} [options.responseType=text] Expected XHR response type.
     * @param {Function} [options.onUploadProgress] Callback for upload progress (XHR only).
     * @returns {Promise}
